vision.notes: Likely functional in deep-sea environments, although specific adaptations are unknown. They are ray-finned fish living in tropical and subtropical waters, implying functional vision for prey detection and navigation.

mechanoreception.notes: Fish possess a lateral line system for detecting vibrations and pressure changes in the water. As bottom-dwelling fish, this would be vital for detecting predators and prey.

chemoreception.notes: Fish use chemoreception (smell and taste) for locating food and mates. The presence of barbels suggests an enhanced role for taste/touch in the benthic zone.
